page.title: 14TRANSPORT AND COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: The original turnpike roads were so difficult to travel along that they didn't encourage people to travel any distance. The first major influence on transportand communications was therefore the building of the canals. At Marple, two canals meet, the{Peak {Forest Canal}and the{Macclesfield {Canal.}The point where the canals meet is at the head of a flight of{16} locks, and is called{Top Lock.}Near to this point were situated coal mines and lime kilns which were both good customers of the canals. There is now a marina at the junction which is well used by pleasure craft, mostly under private ownership. In the Summertime the canals at Marple are very busy with holiday boats and pleasure trips. There is one boat which is used as a floating restaurant called{"The Four {Seasons." }
